resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
nealrichardson commented on pull request #4411: ARROW-5442: [Website] Clarify what makes a release artifact "official"
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4411

nealrichardson commented on pull request #4411: ARROW-5442: [Website] Clarify what makes a release artifact "official"
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4411#discussion_r288804415
 
 

 ##########
 File path: site/install.md
 ##########
 @@ -37,39 +37,40 @@ See the [release notes][10] for more about what's new.
 
 [Java Artifacts on Maven Central][4]
 
-## Binary Installers for C, C++, Python
+### Python Wheels
 
-### C++ and Python Conda Packages (Unofficial)
+We have provided official binary wheels on PyPI for Linux, macOS, and Windows:
+
+```shell
+pip install pyarrow=={{site.data.versions['current'].pinned_number}}
+```
+
+We recommend pinning `{{site.data.versions['current'].pinned_number}}`
+in `requirements.txt` to install the latest patch release.
 
 Review comment:
   Can we remove this? Perhaps an artifact of a bygone unstable time? I'd think we'd want to discourage version pinning (people who want/need to pin will do so anyway).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on pull request #4411: ARROW-5442: [Website] Clarify what makes a release artifact "official"
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4411#discussion_r288804541
 
 

 ##########
 File path: site/install.md
 ##########
 @@ -210,7 +211,7 @@ sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel parquet-devel # For Apache Parquet C++
 sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel parquet-glib-devel # For Parquet GLib (C)
 ```
 
-### C++ and GLib (C) Packages for MSYS2 (Unofficial)
+### C++ and GLib (C) Packages for MSYS2
 
 The official MSYS2 packages include [Apache Arrow C++ and GLib (C)
 
 Review comment:
   I'll note that this seems in conflict: heading said "unofficial" but the sentence says "official"
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #4411: ARROW-5442: [Website] Clarify what makes a release artifact "official"
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4411#discussion_r288846129
 
 

 ##########
 File path: site/install.md
 ##########
 @@ -84,7 +85,7 @@ and GLib (C) package with:
 brew install apache-arrow-glib
 ```
 
-### C++ and GLib (C) Packages for Debian GNU/Linux, Ubuntu and CentOS (Unofficial)
+### C++ and GLib (C) Packages for Debian GNU/Linux, Ubuntu and CentOS
 
 Review comment:
   They are "unofficial" just for 0.13.0 by packaging mistake.
   https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/43ecf510ea3f04a375854f70886195c140d0e96854b43286e389e3c0@%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E
   Normally, this is "official" (voted) binary packages.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #4411: ARROW-5442: [Website] Clarify what makes a release artifact "official"
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4411#discussion_r288846601
 
 

 ##########
 File path: site/install.md
 ##########
 @@ -37,39 +37,40 @@ See the [release notes][10] for more about what's new.
 
 [Java Artifacts on Maven Central][4]
 
-## Binary Installers for C, C++, Python
+### Python Wheels
 
-### C++ and Python Conda Packages (Unofficial)
+We have provided official binary wheels on PyPI for Linux, macOS, and Windows:
+
+```shell
+pip install pyarrow=={{site.data.versions['current'].pinned_number}}
+```
+
+We recommend pinning `{{site.data.versions['current'].pinned_number}}`
+in `requirements.txt` to install the latest patch release.
 
 Review comment:
   We can remove this when we reach 1.0.0.
   API isn't stable until 1.0.0.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

kou commented on pull request #4411: ARROW-5442: [Website] Clarify what makes a release artifact "official"
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4411#discussion_r288846502
 
 

 ##########
 File path: site/install.md
 ##########
 @@ -210,7 +211,7 @@ sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel parquet-devel # For Apache Parquet C++
 sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel parquet-glib-devel # For Parquet GLib (C)
 ```
 
-### C++ and GLib (C) Packages for MSYS2 (Unofficial)
+### C++ and GLib (C) Packages for MSYS2
 
 The official MSYS2 packages include [Apache Arrow C++ and GLib (C)
 
 Review comment:
   I meant this is "official MSYS2 packages" and isn't "official Apache Arrow packages".
   "official MSYS2 packages" means that they are included in https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages .
   
   Anyway, we can remove the "official".
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

-## Binary Installers for C, C++, Python

wesm commented on pull request #4411: ARROW-5442: [Website] Clarify what makes a release artifact "official"
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4411#discussion_r288957237
 
 

 ##########
 File path: site/install.md
 ##########
 @@ -37,39 +37,40 @@ See the [release notes][10] for more about what's new.
 
 [Java Artifacts on Maven Central][4]
 
-## Binary Installers for C, C++, Python
+### Python Wheels
 
-### C++ and Python Conda Packages (Unofficial)
+We have provided official binary wheels on PyPI for Linux, macOS, and Windows:
+
+```shell
+pip install pyarrow=={{site.data.versions['current'].pinned_number}}
+```
+
+We recommend pinning `{{site.data.versions['current'].pinned_number}}`
+in `requirements.txt` to install the latest patch release.
 
 Review comment:
   Version pinning is commonplace in the Python world -- I don't think API stability has much to do with it (we will still have some API changes or deprecations after 1.0 I would guess)

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
See discussion here: [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4401#discussion_r288348562]

In order to minimize FUD, add some explanation and don't shout "unofficial" everywhere. [https://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/Distributions%20and%20Commercial%20Support?action=show&redirect=Distribution] is one model.
fields.summary: [Website] Clarify what makes a release artifact "official"
